intro: Bradburia hirtella, commonly known as the hairy bradburia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Araceae family, which includes plants like peace lilies and calla lilies. The plant is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stem and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, hairy texture, giving it its common name. Bradburia hirtella thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
